components.description:
A badger, a stocky mammal in the weasel family with a long, pointed head. Generally depicted in full profile on all fours facing left, with a gray coat, black-and-white-striped face, and short tail.

Google’s design used to feature a friendly, cartoon-styled black-and-white badger face. Facebook’s badger is sitting on its hind legs.
components.title: Badger

title: Badger

version.description:
Unicode 11.0 was released on June 5, 2018. Emojis that require new code points for release are listed on this page but for the full 2018 emoji list see Emoji 11.0.

Emoji 11.0 includes every new emoji, including variations for skin tone, gender and new emojis that don't require additional code points, such as the chess pawn or pirate flag which are not shown on this page.

apple_vendor_description: The badger emoji on Apple devices is rendered with characteristic tenacity and a touch of wild charm, featuring a distinctive black and white striped face and a robust, rounded body. Appleâ€™s design language imbues it with a sense of earthy realism through subtle textures and realistic lighting, while its soft, rounded form makes it approachable. This emoji on Apple devices can symbolize resilience, determination, or a connection to nature, often used playfully to represent stubbornness or a fierce spirit.
